questions_and_answers.Q: What is the Twinning Program offered by Nitte (Deemed to be University) in collaboration with Penn State University, Harrisburg?
questions_and_answers.A: It allows students of BTech in Computer Science Engineering at Nitte Mahalinga Adyanthaya Memorial Institute of Technology (NMAMIT) to complete part of their study at Penn State University (PSU), Harrisburg.

questions_and_answers.Q: What type of university is Pennsylvania State University (PSU)?
questions_and_answers.A: PSU is a public state-related land-grant research university with campuses and facilities throughout Pennsylvania, USA.

questions_and_answers.Q: What is the rank of Pennsylvania State University (PSU) in the QS World University Rankings of 2023?
questions_and_answers.A: PSU is ranked 93rd in the QS World University Rankings of 2023.

questions_and_answers.Q: How is Nitte (Deemed to be University) rated in terms of accreditation and ranking?
questions_and_answers.A: Nitte (Deemed to be University) is accredited by the National Assessment & Accreditation Council, Government of India with an 'A+' Grade and is ranked 65th in the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) of India in 2023.

questions_and_answers.Q: What opportunities does the Twinning Program provide for students?
questions_and_answers.A: It offers an international learning environment, training in advanced laboratories, and opportunities to enhance cultural competence and networking for future career growth.

questions_and_answers.Q: What is the objective of the Twinning Program?
questions_and_answers.A: The objective is to provide students with the opportunity to study at a highly reputed American university and gain international exposure.

questions_and_answers.Q: How is the Twinning Program structured?
questions_and_answers.A: It follows a model of 2+1+1, with students completing their third year at Penn State University, Harrisburg.

questions_and_answers.Q: What benefits do students receive by studying at Penn State University (PSU) under the Twinning Program?
questions_and_answers.A: Students receive access to advanced laboratories, an international learning environment, and opportunities for networking and cultural competence enhancement.

questions_and_answers.Q: What is the approval status of the Twinning Program?
questions_and_answers.A: The Twinning Program has received approval from the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE).

questions_and_answers.Q: How are the credits earned by students at Penn State University, Harrisburg, recognized?
questions_and_answers.A: The credits earned at PSU, Harrisburg, are recognized towards the degree requirements through a bipartite agreement between NitteDU and PSU.

questions_and_answers.Q: What is the significance of completing the 3rd year at Penn State University, Harrisburg, in the Twinning program?
questions_and_answers.A: It provides students with an opportunity to experience international education, gain exposure to different teaching methodologies, and enhance their academic and cultural competence.

questions_and_answers.Q: What does the bipartite agreement between NitteDU and PSU entail?
questions_and_answers.A: The bipartite agreement outlines the terms and conditions for credit transfer, ensuring that the credits earned at PSU are recognized by NitteDU towards the completion of the degree requirements.

questions_and_answers.Q: How does completing the 3rd year at PSU benefit students in terms of their academic and professional development?
questions_and_answers.A: It allows students to access advanced facilities, engage with industry experts, and broaden their perspectives, enhancing their readiness for the global workforce.

questions_and_answers.Q: How are the credits earned at Penn State Harrisburg transferred back to NitteDU?
questions_and_answers.A: The credits earned at Penn State Harrisburg are transferred back to NitteDU through the established partnership and agreement between the two institutions.

questions_and_answers.Q: What degree do students receive upon successfully completing the Twinning Program?
questions_and_answers.A: Students who successfully complete the program receive a B.Tech in Computer Science Engineering from Nitte (Deemed to be University).

questions_and_answers.Q: How does transferring to Penn State Harrisburg benefit NitteDU students in terms of academic and professional growth?
questions_and_answers.A: Transferring to Penn State Harrisburg provides NitteDU students with access to advanced resources, internship opportunities, and a global learning environment, enhancing their academic and professional skills and preparing them for future career endeavors.

questions_and_answers.Q: how will be the selection of candidates?
questions_and_answers.A: Selection of candidates will be based on their academic performance.

questions_and_answers.Q: What are the prerequisites for acceptance into the semesters of study at Penn State Harrisburg?
questions_and_answers.A: Students must have earned a minimum of 80 credits by the end of the second year at Nitte with a cumulative grade point average (CGPA) of 6.25 on the Nitte Grading Scale, which is equivalent to 2.5 on the Penn State grading scale.

questions_and_answers.Q: How many credits are NitteDU students expected to complete upon transfer to Penn State Harrisburg for the third year?
questions_and_answers.A: NitteDU students are expected to complete 65 credits during their third year at Penn State Harrisburg.

questions_and_answers.Q: what is the program fee of this twinning program?
questions_and_answers.A: For detailed program fee structure please visit https://nmamit.nitte.edu.in/btech_cse_twinningprogram.php
